poem:
Title: Of Ceasefires and Blossoms

In cloistered halls, a man declares it's time,
With stately voice and oh so softened rime;
No influence, a puppet's brittle mime.
Yet, Gaza's heart is not a heathen's chime,
It sings for peace through hours of war and grime.
But still, in shadows of the night sublime,
Each blossom fails, and life is put on prime.
